pullRequest.body:
Supporting lemmas for deducing that a subgraph is a matching.
Added in preparation for Tutte's theorem.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [x] depends on: #11667 

This is in preparation for Tutte's theorem. My (partially complete) approach can be found [here](https://github.com/pimotte/TutteLean/blob/main/TutteLean.lean)

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

```suggestion
    (hd : Disjoint M.support M'.support) : (M âŠ” M').IsMatching := by
  intro v hv
  have aux {N N' : Subgraph G} (hN : N.IsMatching) (hd : Disjoint N.support N'.support)
    (hmN: v âˆˆ N.verts) : âˆƒ! w, (N âŠ” N').Adj v w := by
    obtain âŸ¨w, hwâŸ© := hN hmN
    use w
    refine âŸ¨sup_adj.mpr (.inl hw.1), ?_âŸ©
    intro y hy
    cases hy with
    | inl h => exact hw.2 y h
    | inr h =>
      rw [Set.disjoint_left] at hd
      simpa [(mem_support _).mpr âŸ¨w, hw.1âŸ©, (mem_support _).mpr âŸ¨y, hâŸ©] using @hd v
  cases Set.mem_or_mem_of_mem_union hv with
  | inl hmM => exact aux hM hd hmM
  | inr hmM' =>
    rw [sup_comm]
    exact aux hM' (Disjoint.symm hd) hmM'
```

```suggestion
  obtain âŸ¨i , hiâŸ© := Set.mem_iUnion.mp (verts_iSup â–¸ hv)
  obtain âŸ¨w , hwâŸ© := hM i hi
  use w
  refine âŸ¨iSup_adj.mpr âŸ¨i, hw.1âŸ©, ?_âŸ©
  intro y hy
  obtain âŸ¨i' , hi'âŸ© := iSup_adj.mp hy
  by_cases heq : i = i'
  Â· exact hw.2 y (heq.symm â–¸ hi')
  Â· have := hd _ _ heq
    rw [Set.disjoint_left] at this
    simpa [(mem_support _).mpr âŸ¨w, hw.1âŸ©, (mem_support _).mpr âŸ¨y, hi'âŸ©] using @this v
```

```suggestion
  intro _ hv
  rw [subgraphOfAdj_verts, Set.mem_insert_iff, Set.mem_singleton_iff] at hv
  cases hv with
  | inl => use w; aesop
  | inr => use v; aesop
```

```suggestion
  intro _ hv
  obtain âŸ¨w, hwâŸ© := hM <| Set.mem_of_mem_image_val <| M.coeSubgraph_verts.symm â–¸ hv
  use w
  refine âŸ¨?_, fun y hy => ?_âŸ©
  Â· obtain âŸ¨v, hvâŸ© := (Set.mem_image _ _ _).mp <| (coeSubgraph_verts M).symm â–¸ hv
    simp only [coeSubgraph_adj, Subtype.coe_eta, Subtype.coe_prop, exists_const]
    exact âŸ¨hv.2 â–¸ v.2, hw.1âŸ©
  Â· obtain âŸ¨_, hw', hvwâŸ© := (coeSubgraph_adj _ _ _).mp hy
    rw [â† hw.2 âŸ¨y, hw'âŸ© hvw]
```

```suggestion
intro _ hv
  obtain âŸ¨hv, rflâŸ© := hv
  obtain âŸ¨w, hvw, hwâŸ© := h hv
  use w
  simpa [hv, hvw, M.edge_vert hvw.symm, (M.adj_sub hvw).symm.reachable] using fun _ _ _ â†¦ hw _
```

```suggestion
  c.recOn fun w â†¦ decidable_of_iff (G.Reachable v w) <| by simp fun _ _ _ _ â†¦ Subsingleton.elim _ _
```

```suggestion
      obtain âŸ¨âŸ¨v', hv'âŸ©, hv , rflâŸ© := hv
      use w
      have hwnu : w âˆ‰ u := fun hw' â†¦ h w hw' âŸ¨v', hv'âŸ© hw.1 hv
      refine âŸ¨âŸ¨âŸ¨âŸ¨v', hv'âŸ©, hv, rflâŸ©, ?_, hw.1âŸ©, fun _ hy â†¦ hw.2 _ hy.2.2âŸ©
      apply mem_coe_supp_of_adj âŸ¨âŸ¨v', hv'âŸ©, âŸ¨hv, rflâŸ©âŸ© âŸ¨by trivial, hwnuâŸ©
      simp only [Subgraph.induce_verts, Subgraph.verts_top, Set.mem_diff, Set.mem_univ, true_and,
        Subgraph.induce_adj, Subgraph.top_adj, M.adj_sub hw.1] at hv' âŠ¢
      trivial
    apply Nat.odd_iff_not_even.mp codd
    haveI : Fintype (Subgraph.induce M (Subtype.val '' c.supp)).verts := Fintype.ofFinite _
    haveI : Fintype c.supp := Fintype.ofFinite _
    have hMeven := Subgraph.IsMatching.even_card hMmatch
    simp only [Subgraph.induce_verts, Set.toFinset_image, Nat.card_eq_fintype_card,
      Set.toFinset_card, Finset.card_image_of_injective _ (Subtype.val_injective)] at hMeven âŠ¢
```

```suggestion
lemma subgraphOfAdj_support {u v : V} (h : G.Adj u v) :
    (G.subgraphOfAdj h).support = {u , v} := by
  ext
  rw [Subgraph.mem_support]
  simp only [subgraphOfAdj_adj, Sym2.eq, Sym2.rel_iff', Prod.mk.injEq, Prod.swap_prod_mk]
  refine âŸ¨?_, fun h â†¦ h.elim (fun hl â†¦ âŸ¨v, .inl âŸ¨hl.symm, rflâŸ©âŸ©) fun hr â†¦ âŸ¨u, .inr âŸ¨rfl, hr.symmâŸ©âŸ©âŸ©
  rintro âŸ¨_, hwâŸ©
  exact hw.elim (fun h1 â†¦ .inl h1.1.symm) fun hr â†¦ .inr hr.2.symm
```

To match the naming convention:
```suggestion
lemma IsMatching.map_ofLE (h : M.IsMatching) (hGG' : G â‰¤ G') :
```
or
```suggestion
lemma IsMatching.map_homOfLE (h : M.IsMatching) (hGG' : G â‰¤ G') :
```
(I think the first one is better)

```suggestion
lemma IsMatching.sup (hM : M.IsMatching) (hM' : M'.IsMatching)
```

```suggestion
lemma IsMatching.iSup {Î¹ : Sort _} {f : Î¹ â†’ Subgraph G} (hM : (i : Î¹) â†’ (f i).IsMatching)
```
for *anonymous dot notation*: This lets you write `.iSup _ : IsMatching _`

The use of dot notation shouldn't change the lemma name
```suggestion
lemma support_subgraphOfAdj {u v : V} (h : G.Adj u v) :
```

Same here
```suggestion
lemma verts_coeSubgraph {G' : Subgraph G} (G'' : Subgraph G'.coe) :
```
Simp lemma, no?
Added

```suggestion
lemma IsMatching.coeSubgraph {G' : Subgraph G} {M : Subgraph G'.coe} (hM : M.IsMatching) :
```

```suggestion
lemma IsMatching.subgraphOfAdj (h : G.Adj v w) : (G.subgraphOfAdj h).IsMatching := by
```
Hopefully you get the pattern from these

```suggestion
    (hd : Pairwise fun i j â†¦ Disjoint (f i).support (f j).support) :
```
Probably good as a simp lemma?
Added:)

```suggestion

@[simp]
```

```suggestion
    (â¨† i, f i).IsMatching := by
```
